abstract: Report by National Assessment of Educational Progress shows math performance of American high school seniors dropped from 2013 to 2015 but remained steady in reading; results also indicate fewer students are ready for college, development educators call worrisome.
lead_paragraph: Average performance dropped in math from 2013 to 2015 but held steady in reading, results from the National Assessment of Educational Progress showed.

headline.main: Test Scores Show a Decline in Math Among High School Seniors
headline.print_headline: Test Scores Indicate a Decline in How Well High School Seniors Know Math

snippet: Average performance dropped in math from 2013 to 2015 but held steady in reading, results from the National Assessment of Educational Progress showed.
